ygData.subject: Re: Binding or not...
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Great, just what we need a bunch of pansy wizards and wimpy druids running around.  By making a comment like the one above, you alienate 50% of the players
ygData.messageBody:
>I will be bold and say that well if you really feel the
>need to be able to be bound anywhere, play a class that
>can bind. If you cant live without the bind spell, then a
>bard, warrior, ranger, shadowknight, paladin, rogue is
>properly not your kind of class.

Great, just what we need a bunch of pansy wizards and wimpy
druids running around. By making a comment like the one
above, you alienate 50% of the players of the game. This
is not the intention on a company who would like to make
money. Last time I saw a party without a melee player, they
littered the floor of SolB, dead.

>Let us morons who dont mind running the 1208402 (or 2-3
>which is much more common) zones to get our corpse play
>the other classes. I still think that I can get to almost
>any zone within a reasonble amount of time

I hate to say this, but you've misspoken. Gain some levels and
graduate from Blackburrow. We had to Succor to North Karana
3 f'ing times the other night. It's a MINIMUM 10 min run
back to Permafrost. But the casters just personal gated
right back into the action. It doesn't always have to do
with corpse recovery. I was bound in Halas, and _still_ had
a long walk ahead of me. I am the fasting moving thing in
Norrath save two things, bards higher than me and SoN.

It's completely idiotic that I cannot be bound anywhere a
caster will bind me. You don't need a popup box, because
you already have to be in a group with the person. How can
someone maliciously bind me unless I group with them?

I'm tired of running from Arena to Guk, and running from
North Karana to Permafrost when all my other group members
are either 1) waiting for us melee folk 2) blasting up
monsters left and right, gaining exp/loot.

It ruins my night. And as it ruins more and more people's
fun, you will most likely see this change - count on it.

Harmonic Distortion, 37th unchained melody.
League of Antonican Bards, The Wind Spirit's Song
< Keepers of Norrath > Innoruuk
